page.title: 05Pheasant Rearing.
page.content: In February and March the gamekeeper collects hen pheasants,cuts their flight feathers on one wing and keeps the birds in a holding pen.Cock pheasants are also collected.There are 600 hens in the pens at Dairy Lane at present.In April the eggs are collected from the ground.As there may be as many as 21 eggs in one clutch,additional help is required to collect and transfer them to an incubator.Lord Hambleden's incubator can accommodate 8000 eggs on trays which are tipped automatically twice a day.When hatched, the chicks are transferred to brooder houses in fields.After 7 weeks,the chicks are taken to release pens,6 feet high, in the woods.The flight feathers are pulled and they are fed and watered.Three months later the wires are laid down and the birds come and go as they wish.
